topic.title: Software License Agreement
topic.description: A new software license agreement is proposed for our company to use their latest version of a proprietary software. The terms and conditions are as follows: the company will pay $10,000 per year for a single user license, with an additional $5,000 for each additional user.
topic.context: Our company has been using this software for over two years now and has grown significantly due to its efficiency. We believe that our growth is justified by the benefits we have received from it.

parties.name: ABC Inc.
constraints: Dependence on the software for daily operations

conflictPoints.description: The primary point of conflict is the pricing. ABC Inc. believes that $10,000 per year is too expensive for a single user license, while XYZ Software Solutions thinks it is fair considering the software's capabilities and development costs.
conflictPoints.impact: Impact on business operations due to the need for alternative software solutions.

currentPosition.party1Position: $5,000 per year for a single user license
currentPosition.party2Position: $10,000 per year for a single user license

acceptableRange.minimum: $4,000 per year for a single user license
acceptableRange.maximum: $15,000 per year for a single user license
acceptableRange.preferredOutcome: $8,000 per year for a single user license and $3,000 per additional user

nonNegotiablePoints.description: The non-negotiable point is the inclusion of intellectual property rights in the licensing agreement.
nonNegotiablePoints.rationale: Protecting our company's proprietary information and preventing unauthorized use or distribution.
nonNegotiablePoints.impact: Impact on our ability to defend our business interests.

party1Conditions.reasoning: Exceeds the acceptable range for a single user license.

party1Conditions.condition: Inadequate support or updates after purchase
party1Conditions.reasoning: Impact on business operations due to lack of necessary updates and support.

party2Conditions.condition: Rejection of the proposed pricing structure
party2Conditions.threshold: $4,000 per year for a single user license
party2Conditions.reasoning: Below-market pricing that may affect revenue generation.

longTermObjectives.objective: Establish a long-term partnership with XYZ Software Solutions while maintaining a balance between costs and benefits.
